text.sentence: Hi Lei,
How are you? Haven't heard from you in a while.
I guess you went back to China already.
How are things working out?
We are ok here, and Sujatha has got back to NEC.
She will be there till March.
I am working on a problem with Partha.
Hey Shibu,
I am in Beijing now living in my friend's dorm and looking for a room to stay.
We just had our lunar new year festival, so I went back home last several days and spent time with my parents.
I didn't have much time living with my parents since I have sth else to do here.
I am getting busy. What I am doing is related to economics and I am trying to find research idea in it.
Also I am happy to get in contact with my old labmates again and I can also do some study with them.
And for you to know, I sold my malibu, and subleased my room in parkway.
I am hoping that I can do sth in the next 6 months, maybe submit a couple of papers, then I can go back to penn state to have my comprehensive exam expectedly in August or September.
After all these years living in the US, I found that now it doesn't really matter to me where I live, I will just live where I can find more friends and have somereal stuff to do.
Isn't it also interesting to move to another country/city once in a while and enjoy your life there?
Let me know if you have plans going back Asia, you can stop by Beijing and we can meet here :-) also if there is any change in penn state, please get me updated.
Yes, you are right.
I'll definitely let you know if I go to Beijing/ China.
It's good that you spent some time with your family. :-)
Here I and Partha are working on some problems related to multi-agent systems, game theory and clustering.
Now hopefully things will work out, because Partha is a very good friend as well as a great collaborator.
I wish and hope things will work out very good on your part as well.
Just one thing to let you know.
I am going to Tokyo on Feb 19 for a conference (CICLING 2011), and will be coming back on Feb 27.
I had a paper accepted there. Right now I've couple more papers in submission - one with Partha to IJCAI, another short paper to JCDL.
I had to argue really hard with Dr Mitra to make him understand what I'm going to submit, where and why.
Finally he admitted what I was doing, although not fully convinced.
In any case, I am funding my trip to Tokyo, not Dr Mitra, so I don't think he can say anything much about it.
For the Greek project, I am collaborating with Dr Zoe Stamatopoulou.
She is a faculty in classics department, and knows both Ancient and Modern Greek really well.
She took a lot of interest in the project, and is advising me on its key aspects and research issues.
And for my colloquialism (formality-informality) problem, I am collaborating with an applied linguist at PSU, Dr Xiaofei Lu.
He is a really nice person and advises so well.
I am taking a corpus analysis course under him in this semester.
In that course, he is teaching us Awk and Python.
So, finally, I'm also learning Python and I'm loving it! :-) :-)
Partha also took this course with me, and he has also fallen in love with Python. :-) :-)
text.signature: Wish you all the best in life. Shibu P.S. - Good timber does not grow with ease: The stronger the wind, the stronger the trees; The further the sky, the greater the length; The more the storm, the more the strength. - Douglas Malloch
